text:
<!everyone> hope your week is off to a great start! let's start with January's most popular threads:
1. <https://content-career-growth.slack.com/archives/CJE3XC0H3/p1641917537026600|This thread about our 2022 salary report> :money_mouth_face: (this is updated with benefit/perk data as of today, see image below)
2. <https://content-career-growth.slack.com/archives/CJ7QQKJ73/p1642009446097800|This thread on creating high quality content on tangentially-related topics> (:wave: <@UNA88V285>)
3. <https://content-career-growth.slack.com/archives/CN9UCQ92A/p1642436560017800|This thread on the importance (or not?) of metadata in SEO> (:wave: <@U02CVNB3X1T>)
4. <https://content-career-growth.slack.com/archives/CJ7QQKJ73/p1642531396217900|This thread on which metrics folks report on each month> (:wave:<@UNA88V285>)
5. <https://content-career-growth.slack.com/archives/CUYDAGXKR/p1642612214037500|This thread on including dates on blog posts> (:wave: <@U02GXAY8WLS>)
a few other things:
• i've been toying with sunsetting the <#CKRJX5U5A|guest-posts> and <#CK1HFB8SD|writing-feedback> channels. do you feel strongly either way?
• is there interest in web3? i'm thinking we should bring in an expert for an AMA/webinar.
• here's a new $100k club post: <https://superpath.co/blog/freelance-writerconsultant-earning-127k-plus-30k-in-subcontractor-revenue|Freelance writer/consultant earning $127k (plus $30k in subcontractor revenue)>
• <https://twitter.com/jimmy_daly/status/1488550503394918401|here are some content trends i've noticed over the past few months>. curious if you thoughts on these (or if you disagree!)
okay, that's all for today. hope you have an awesome week!
:v:jimmy

text: I love Cathryn Lavery's Web3 content... her intro to defi course is making waves: <https://courses.littlemight.com/zerotodefi/xedmr> (Aff link)

text: This may be pretty basic but: what is the definition of “content marketer” for the purpose of the survey? I’m surprised the survey didn’t summarize the responsibilities of the role. The term coupe include many different subsets and even content writers.

elements.text: This may be pretty basic but: what is the definition of “content marketer” for the purpose of the survey? I’m surprised the survey didn’t summarize the responsibilities of the role. The term coupe include many different subsets and even content writers.

text: I do like to browse <#CKRJX5U5A|guest-posts>…maybe it could be turned into #collaboration-opportunities or something similar, so there’s still a formal channel for partnership?

text:
<#CKRJX5U5A|guest-posts> is a good one and has brought us a lot of value!

I had posted a single thread a long time ago and while nobody replied to the thread itself, at least 10 people wrote to me in the span of 2 months (interestingly.. I received the last message about 2 months after posting, so people do check the history, too)
